item.title: Biden commutes dozens of death row sentences to life without parole
item.description: The sentences of 37 of the 40 federal inmates on death row will be reclassified to life without the possibility of parole, the White House said.

item.title: Donald Trump says Vladimir Putin wants a meeting as soon as possible about the war with Ukraine
item.description: "President Putin said that he wants to meet with me as soon as possible," Trump said during his remarks at Turning Point's America Fest convention.

item.description: Stocks have struggled ahead of the holidays despite Friday’s rally.

item.description: Trading is expected to be relatively muted during the holiday week.

item.title: Britain's economy flatlined in the third quarter, revised figures show
item.description: U.K. GDP flatlined in the three months to September, official figures showed on Monday.

item.title: ‘I just like to have the lights up’: Nicole Kidman admits to big holiday decor no-no
item.description: Kidman confessed to her divisive habit, and has actually “apologized to all the neighbors” for her over-the-top decor.

item.title: Honda and Nissan officially begin merger talks to create world's third-largest automaker
item.description: Both companies are grappling with intense global competition in the electric vehicle market from the likes of Tesla and China's BYD.

item.title: ‘I’ve always been very good with money’: Should I put my wife on the title of our family home, investment property and my late father’s house?
item.description: “If I die and she sells the properties, would she have to pay a lot of capital-gains taxes, especially on the houses we don’t live in?”

item.title: The latest victim in a string of break-ins at athletes’ mansions: Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown
item.description: Jaylen Brown has become the latest athlete to be targeted in a string of robberies that have taken place at the homes of high-profile sports stars.
